alert.note: Alert for Tarrant (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 22 at 9:55AM CDT until August 22 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Tarrant County in north central Texas... * Until 100 PM CDT. * At 955 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fort Worth, Arlington, Irving, Grand Prairie, Mansfield, Euless, Bedford, Grapevine, Haltom City, Keller, Coppell, Hurst, Burleson, Southlake, Watauga, Colleyville, Benbrook, Saginaw, White Settlement and Crowley. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
